Package stochasticSimulation

Class Death

  • java.lang.Object
    • stochasticSimulation.StochasticEvent
      • stochasticSimulation.Death
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Event

    class Death
extends StochasticEvent
    Author:
    Manuel Serra Death is a subclass of StochasticEvent, implementing the simulateEvent method. After the simulation of a death the individual associated with it is removed from the population where it lives

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class stochasticSimulation.StochasticEvent

        ind, sim, time, type

      Constructor of a Death event.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void simulateEvent​()
      Simulates the death event.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

      • Methods inherited from class stochasticSimulation.StochasticEvent

        equals, expRandom, getInd, getIndID, getTime, hashCode, setSim, toString

    • Constructor Detail

      • Death

        Death​(Individual ind)
        Constructor of a Death event. It defines the fields inherited from the superclass and computes a time for the event based on an exponential distribution, adding to the current time of the simulation. The time of death is then 'stamped' in the individual associated with the event.
        Parameters:
        ind - is the individual to be associated with the death event.

    • Method Detail

      • simulateEvent

        public void simulateEvent​()
        Simulates the death event. The individual associated with the death is removed from the population and cleared from memory. Event counter is incremented.
        Specified by:
        simulateEvent in interface Event
        Specified by:
        simulateEvent in class StochasticEvent
